intro: Cochlearia vulgaris, commonly known as the common cochlearia, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained conditions. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces small, rounded fruits called siliques. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit and is often found in maritime environments.
